com.example.hangman

Class HangmanGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.hangman.HangmanGame

  • public class HangmanGame
extends Object

    Overview

    This class is used to implement that actual hangman game. It includes all of the funcitonality to play the game, such that the only thing a user of this class must do is create an instance, and supply a guess String (the funciton parses it to its first character).

    Testing Summary

    The correctness of this class was tested in conjunction with the HangmanActivity. For more details on the testing conditions, consult the HangmanActivity notes.

    Author:
    Daniel Griffin, Jordan Ross

      private String currentString
      Variable that holds the current hangman string.

      Variable that holds the number of guesses left for the user to try and guess the word.
      static int IN_PROGRESS
      Constant returned by getGameStatus() when the game is still in progress.
      private String solutionString
      Variable used to hold the solution string, or the string that is trying to be guessed.
      static int USER_LOST
      Constant returned by getGameStatus() when the user has lost the game.
      static int USER_WON
      Constant returned by getGameStatus() when the user has won the game.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getCurrentHangmanString()
      Description: Method returns the current hangman string containing previously guessed correct letters, as well as unguessed letters (represented by a "_")

        public static final int USER_WON
        Constant returned by getGameStatus() when the user has won the game.
        See Also:

        public static final int USER_LOST
        Constant returned by getGameStatus() when the user has lost the game.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IN_PROGRESS

        public static final int IN_PROGRESS
        Constant returned by getGameStatus() when the game is still in progress.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • solutionString

        private String solutionString
        Variable used to hold the solution string, or the string that is trying to be guessed.

      • getNumRemaining

        private int getNumRemaining
        Variable that holds the number of guesses left for the user to try and guess the word. There is a maximum of 7.

      • currentString

        private String currentString
        Variable that holds the current hangman string. This includes previously found letters as well as letters not found yet (represented by "_").

    • Constructor Detail

      • HangmanGame

        public HangmanGame(String word)
        Default fill constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • getGameStatus

        public int getGameStatus()
        Description: Method is used to get the current status of the game.
        Returns:
        USER_WON if the user has won the game. USER_LOST if the user has lost the game. IN_PROGRESS if the game is still in progress (The user still has chances to guess the word)

      • tryGuess

        public String tryGuess(String guess)
        Description: Method accepts a guess, and checks to see if that guess is in the solution string. If it is, it adds the letter to the current hangman string (including repeats) and returns the new hangman string.
        Parameters:
        guess - the string representing the character guess.
        Returns:
        returns the string containing previously guessed correct letters, as well as unguessed letters (represented by a "_").

      • getNumRemaining

        public int getNumRemaining()
        Description: Method returns the number of guesses the user has remaining.

      • getCurrentHangmanString

        public String getCurrentHangmanString()
        Description: Method returns the current hangman string containing previously guessed correct letters, as well as unguessed letters (represented by a "_")

      • getSolutionString

        public String getSolutionString()
        Description: Method returns the solution string that the user is trying to guess.
